items.sentence: Even though Tom insisted that we do that, we didn't do it.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary would be reasonable.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was unfazed by that.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was good at cooking.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was engaged to John.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was being sarcastic.
Tom told me that he doesn't know any other way to do that.
Tom told me that he didn't know why Mary did what she did.
Tom told me that he didn't have time to do that right now.
I don't think Tom can play the violin as well as Mary can.
I don't think that Tom is going to study French next year.
I don't think Tom knows why I don't like living in Boston.
I don't think Tom knows how much money he has in the bank.
I don't think it's very likely Tom will tell us the truth.
I don't think you need to tell Tom why you went Australia.
I don't think you need to tell Tom why you went to Boston.
I don't think that Tom will be sleeping when we get there.
I suspect that Tom and Mary don't need to do that anymore.
I suspect that Tom and Mary aren't going to do that today.
I suspect that Tom and Mary are sick of each other by now.
